net.dean.jraw.http

Interface HttpAdapter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OkHttpAdapter

    public interface HttpAdapter
    This interface provides a library-inspecific way of executing HTTP requests.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void authenticate(BasicAuthData authData)
      Sets the username and password to use when a RestRequest is using HTTP Basic Authentication.
      void deauthenticate()
      Revokes the current HTTP Basic Authentication credentials.
      RestResponse execute(HttpRequest request)
      Executes an HTTP request.
      int getConnectTimeout()
      Gets the time in milliseconds the HTTP client will wait while trying to connect before timing out
      java.net.CookieManager getCookieManager()
      Gets the CookieManager being used by the HTTP client
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getDefaultHeaders()
      Gets a not-null, mutable Map of the headers that will be sent with every new HTTP request.
      java.net.Proxy getProxy()
      Gets the effective HTTP proxy
      int getReadTimeout()
      Gets the maximum amount of time in milliseconds the HTTP client will spend trying to read new connections.
      int getWriteTimeout()
      Gets the maximum amount of time in milliseconds the HTTP client will spend trying to write to new connections.
      boolean isFollowingRedirects()
      Checks if this adapter will follow redirects (3xx status codes)
      void setConnectTimeout(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Sets the time in milliseconds the HTTP client will wait while trying to connect before timing out
      void setCookieManager(java.net.CookieManager manager)
      Sets the CookieManager for the HTTP client to use.
      void setFollowRedirects(boolean flag)
      Enables or disables following redirects
      void setProxy(java.net.Proxy proxy)
      Sets a proxy for the HTTP client to send requests through
      void setReadTimeout(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Sets the maximum amount of time in milliseconds the HTTP client will spend trying to read new connections.
      void setWriteTimeout(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Gets the maximum amount of time in milliseconds the HTTP client will spend trying to write to new connections.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        RestResponse execute(HttpRequest request)
              throws NetworkException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Executes an HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        request - A model containing all necessary data
        Returns:
        A RestResponse from the resulting request
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an implementation-specific error occurred.
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful. A request is considered unsuccessful if the HTTP status code is less than 300 and greater than or equal to 200.

      • getConnectTimeout

        int getConnectTimeout()
        Gets the time in milliseconds the HTTP client will wait while trying to connect before timing out
        Returns:
        Connection timeout in milliseconds

      • setConnectTimeout

        void setConnectTimeout(long timeout,
                       java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the time in milliseconds the HTTP client will wait while trying to connect before timing out
        Parameters:
        timeout - Length of timeout, or 0 for none

      • getReadTimeout

        int getReadTimeout()
        Gets the maximum amount of time in milliseconds the HTTP client will spend trying to read new connections. May not be available in all libraries.
        Returns:
        Read timeout in milliseconds

      • setReadTimeout

        void setReadTimeout(long timeout,
                    java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the maximum amount of time in milliseconds the HTTP client will spend trying to read new connections. May not be available in all libraries.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Length of timeout, or 0 for none

      • getWriteTimeout

        int getWriteTimeout()
        Gets the maximum amount of time in milliseconds the HTTP client will spend trying to write to new connections. May not be available in all libraries.
        Returns:
        Write timeout in milliseconds

      • setWriteTimeout

        void setWriteTimeout(long timeout,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Gets the maximum amount of time in milliseconds the HTTP client will spend trying to write to new connections. May not be available in all libraries.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Length of timeout, or 0 for none

      • isFollowingRedirects

        boolean isFollowingRedirects()
        Checks if this adapter will follow redirects (3xx status codes)

      • setFollowRedirects

        void setFollowRedirects(boolean flag)
        Enables or disables following redirects

      • getProxy

        java.net.Proxy getProxy()
        Gets the effective HTTP proxy

      • setProxy

        void setProxy(java.net.Proxy proxy)
        Sets a proxy for the HTTP client to send requests through

      • getCookieManager

        java.net.CookieManager getCookieManager()
        Gets the CookieManager being used by the HTTP client

      • setCookieManager

        void setCookieManager(java.net.CookieManager manager)
        Sets the CookieManager for the HTTP client to use. If the HTTP library does not support setting a CookieHandler but does use the Java default handler, then it is recommended to use CookieHandler.setDefault(CookieHandler) in addition.

      • authenticate

        void authenticate(BasicAuthData authData)
        Sets the username and password to use when a RestRequest is using HTTP Basic Authentication. These credentials should not be revoked until deauthenticate() is called.

      • deauthenticate

        void deauthenticate()
        Revokes the current HTTP Basic Authentication credentials. HTTP Basic Authentication should not be used until authenticate(BasicAuthData) is called.

      • getDefaultHeaders

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getDefaultHeaders()
        Gets a not-null, mutable Map of the headers that will be sent with every new HTTP request.
